column1: Purpose: Defines what the male narrative expects or assumes in relational dynamics.

column4: “She’s strong if she doesn’t need me”
“She’s easygoing if she doesn’t ask much”
“She’s committed if she helps at home”
“She loves me if she lets it go”
“She’s proud of me if she shows it”
“She loves me if she moves on fast”
“She believes in me if she praises me”
“She trusts me if she doesn’t question”
“She’s easygoing if she doesn’t ask much”
“She’s committed if she helps at home”
“She’s mine if she defends me privately”
“She’s proud of me if she shows it”
“She’s fair if she doesn’t ask for more”
“We’re solid if we want the same future”
“She values me if she compliments me”
“She respects my space if she doesn’t probe”
“She respects my space if she doesn’t ask questions”
“She still wants me if she’s open”
“She supports me if she doesn’t challenge me publicly”
“We’re solid if we want the same future”
“She’s fair if she doesn’t ask for more”
“She values me if she compliments me”
“She trusts me if she doesn’t dig too deep”
“She’s mine if she defends me privately”
“She’s committed if she helps at home”
“She loves me if she moves on fast”
“She believes in me if she praises me”
“She trusts me if she doesn’t question”
“She’s proud of me if she shows it”
“She’s mine if she doesn’t confide in others”
